item.title: Natural Language Understanding for Conversational AI
item.description: Summary Natural Language Understanding (NLU) is an important field of Natural Language Processing, which enables several applications ranging from question answering to fully automated conversational agents. In practice, the NLU is the first step of a conversational agent that processes the user’s raw utterance.

item.title: Why are time-series databases relevant for a Conversational AI platform?
item.description: What is time-series data? Time-series data is present everywhere, and typically, we are talking about significant amounts of data. Time-series data typically consists of data points that may represent instances of events that are tracked and aggregated continuously over a period of time.

item.title: Conversational AI Mailing List
item.description: We’ve launched a Conversational AI mailing list as part of our commitment to allow for more accessible communication on a crucial topic: Conversational AI Agents. The lack of mailings that share, discuss, and brainstorm the development, business, and research problems when designing and implementing conversational agents has been identified as a massive gap.

item.title: iFetch Talking Series
item.description: This week marks the start of a series of talks about the iFetch project that I’ll be giving. Our goal with iFetch is to create a trustworthy multimodal conversational agent for the online fashion marketplace.

item.title: Weekly coffee conversations with Ricardo G. Sousa
item.description: Our team is committed to contributing to the discussion and sharing updates related to our national AI ecosystem. Our objective is to smooth the pathways between fundamental research, applications, and business.

item.title: Call for Mentees - Mentorship Program on Conversational Agents @ VISUM 2022
item.description: Earlier this month, we have announced the collaboration with VISUM Summer School in a new Mentorship Program initiative (see our post here). Today we bring you more updates on this initiative.

item.title: VISUM 2022 - Mentorship Program (Opportunity to learn how to build multimodal conversational agents)
item.description: We are thrilled to announce that we will work with VISUM 2022 on a new Mentorship Program initiative. It will be an inspiring opportunity for young researchers to get feedback from senior scholars and industrial researchers in Machine Learning and Computer Vision.

item.title: Project Update & Season Greetings
item.description: iFetch team is a multidisciplinary project that aims to research conversational technology and algorithms that will impact FARFETCH high-end fashion business. After 15 months of research and development, we are thrilled to accomplish pivotal milestones aligned with our ambitions.

item.title: Graph Communities in High-End Fashion Outfit Complementary Retrieval
item.description: Earlier this year, we announced our participation in the VISUM 2021 edition. This challenge will act as a starting point for exploring the recommendation of complementary products, allowing the integration of a baseline in the iFetch project, which our partners are investigating at Instituto Superior Tecnico.

item.title: MuCAI Workshop Update - Keynote Speaker: Professor Eugene Agichtein
item.description: As previously announced, we are organizing a Workshop On Multimedia Conversational AI at ACM Multimedia 2021 ( original blog post). In this blog post, we announce the Keynote Speaker: Professor Eugene Agichtein.

item.title: iFetch at "Encontro Ciencia 2021"
item.description: On the 28th of June at Centro de Congressos Lisbon, FARFETCH participated in “The contribution of the CMU Portugal international partnership for the high-tech Unicorn ecosystem in Portugal” within the “Encontro Ciência 2021” event.

item.title: iFetch at CVPR
item.description: In online shopping applications, the daily insertion of new products requires an overwhelming annotation effort. Usually done by humans, it comes at a huge cost and yet generates high rates of noisy/missing labels that seriously hinder the effectiveness of CNNs in multi-label classification.

item.title: Workshop on Multimodal Conversational AI (MuCAI) @ ACM Multimedia 2021
item.description: iFetch team is organizing a workshop on Multimodal Conversational Agents to be held this year at ACM Multimedia. More details will be shared soon. Important Dates Submission deadline: August 10th 2021

item.title: iFetch with a publication accepted at ECIR 2021
item.description: We are pleased to inform that we have a new publication in the 43rd European Conference on Information Retrieval (ECIR 2021). The publication presents a complete conversational search pipeline that includes various state-of-the-art approaches to rewrite queries, re-rank results, and summarize retrieved answers.

item.title: FARFETCH is a Sponsor of VISUM 2021 Summer School
item.description: FARFETCH is sponsoring VISUM summer school. iFetch team is happy to take part in this initiate by proposing a new project under the umbrella of information retrieval (with application on conversational agents) that VISUM applicants will need to address throughout the summer school.

item.title: New Publication at ACM MM 2020
item.description: We are happy to announce that our recent publication is now available at ACM digital library. Title: Adaptive temporal triplet-loss for cross-modal embedding learning. Abstract: “There are many domains where the temporal dimension is critical to unveil how different modalities, such as images and texts, are correlated.

item.title: Multimodal Conversational AI - ACM Multimedia 2020 workshop
item.description: We are organizing a workshop at ACM Multimedia 2020 - Multimodal Conversational AI (MuCAI). Conversational agents are now becoming a commodity as a number of companies push for this technology. The wide use of these conversational agents exposes the many challenges in achieving more natural, human-like, and engaging conversational agents.

item.title: New Job Offer @ Senior Applied Scientist
item.description: Announcement! iFetch has a new opening! If you’re someone eager to learn more, to contribute to the evolution of systems based on theoretical explanation and able to applying their knowledge and implementing solutions at scale, this job is for you.

item.title: Scholarships will soon be available
item.description: Scholarships will soon be available! Following the stepping stones for iFetch, we would like to announce that scholarships from UNL and IST will soon be available. Stay on top of the announcements that will be made available on our blog!

item.title: New Job Offer @ Senior Data Scientist - Computer Vision
item.description: Announcement! We would like to announce that the iFetch is hiring! If you’re an expert in Computer Vision with experience in conversational agents, and keen to learn more, send your resume through our recruitment platform.

item.title: Participation in the Conversational Search Panel @ ECIR 2020
item.description: Last week we were part of the conversational search panel at the European Conference on Information Retrieval #ECIR2020! This was a remarkable experience! We have covered topics from the landscape of Information Retrieval (IR), how it can impact the user experience to user modelling.

item.title: iFetch Project Website
item.description: iFetch proposes to research and deliver a new generation of task-oriented conversational agents that interact with users using verbal and visual information in a seamless manner. Through the conversation, iFetch must provide targeted advice and “physical store-like” experience while maintaining user engagement.
